What is the difference between primary and secondary infections?

Primary infections are caused by primary pathogens and are typically the first infection a person experiences. Secondary infections occur when a person with a weakened immune system is infected with a different pathogen, often as a result of the primary infection.
What about opportunistic infections?
Opportunistic infections are infections that occur when the immune system is weakened and a pathogen that is normally harmless becomes harmful.
